title: 106_s1393
content:
The "Veterans' Compensation Cost-of-Living Adjustment Act of 1999" increases rates of disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation under title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will increase disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation rates effective December 1, 1999. This includes adjustments to various dollar amounts specified in title 38, United States Code. The increase in disability compensation and dependency and indemnity compensation rates, effective December 1, 1999, includes adjustments to dollar amounts specified in title 38, United States Code. The increase is determined based on the dollar amounts specified in subsection (b) as of November 30, 1999, and is linked to benefit amounts payable under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act's title II payments increased on December 1, 1999, due to a determination under section 215(i). Dollar amounts are rounded down if not whole. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can adjust disability compensation rates for certain individuals. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will publish adjusted rates in the Federal Register in conjunction with Social Security Act requirements. Disability compensation rates can be amended. Section 1114 is amended to adjust various subsections by increasing the dollar amounts specified. Section 1114 is amended to adjust dollar amounts specified in various subsections as follows: "$1,989"; "$2,474" and "$3,470"; "$2,729"; "$3,105"; "$3,470"; "$1,490" and "$2,218"; "$2,227". SEC. 6. Rate amendments for additional compensation for dependents: Adjustments made to dollar amounts in various clauses. SEC. 7. Rate amendment for clothing allowance for certain disabled veterans: Dollar amount adjusted. SEC. 8. Rate amendments for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. New Law Rates in section 1311(a) are updated to $861 for paragraph (1) and $187 for paragraph (2). The table in section 1311(a)(3) is also amended. If the veteran served as Chairman or Vice Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Chief of Staff of the Army, Chief of Naval Operations, Chief of Staff of the Air Force, Commandant of the Marine Corps, or Commandant of the Coast Guard, the surviving spouse's rate is $1,966. Rate adjustments for Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC) for children: Section 1311(b) amended to increase from $215 to $217, Section 1311(c) amended to increase from $215 to $217, and Section 1311(d) amended to increase from $104 to $105. SEC. 9. Rate adjustments for Dependency and Indemnity Compensation (DIC) for children: Increases in DIC rates for orphan children and supplemental DIC for disabled adult children. Effective date is specified in SEC. 10. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on November 30, 1999.
